intro: Rytigynia neglecta, commonly known as the slender senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its typical pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The seeds are enclosed in narrow, woody pods, which contribute to its ecological role in its native habitat.
